org.jetel.data

Class ListDataField

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.DataField
      • org.jetel.data.DataFieldImpl
        • org.jetel.data.ListDataField
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>, java.lang.Iterable<DataField>

    public class ListDataField
extends DataFieldImpl
implements java.lang.Iterable<DataField>
    This data field implementation represents a list of fields, which are uniformly typed by a simple type (string, integer, decimal, ...). Lists of lists (or maps) are not supported. Metadata for this data container are same as for other data fields, only DataFieldMetadata.getContainerType() method returns DataFieldContainerType.LIST.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setNull

        public void setNull(boolean isNull)
        Description copied from class: DataField
        Sets the Null value indicator/status. If passed-in value is True, then the field's internal value is set to NULL. The nullability of the field is checked and if the NULL value is not permitted, the BadDataFormatException is thrown.
        Overrides:
        setNull in class DataFieldImpl
        Parameters:
        isNull - The new Null value

      • setToDefaultValue

        public void setToDefaultValue()
        Description copied from class: DataField
        An operation that sets value of the data field to default value. If default value is not preset, tries to set field value to null.
        Overrides:
        setToDefaultValue in class DataFieldImpl

      • removeField

        public boolean removeField(DataField field)
        Remove the given field from the list. Removed field is stored in a cache and can be used later by this ListDataField for addField() operation, so the return value is still under control of this list.
        Parameters:
        field - the field which is requested be deleted
        Returns:
        true if field was removed, false otherwise

      • removeField

        public DataField removeField(int index)
        Remove a field on the given index. Removed field is stored in a cache and can be used later by this ListDataField for addField() operation, so the return value is still under control of this list.
        Parameters:
        index - index of a field, which is requested to be removed
        Returns:
        removed field
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

        Parameters:

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: DataField
        An operation which sets/resets field to its initial value (just after it was created by JVM) - it varies depending on type of field.
        Nullable fields are set to NULL, non-nullable are zeroed, if they have default value defined, then default value is assigned.
        Specified by:
        reset in class DataField

      • getValue

        public java.util.List<?> getValue()
        This method returns list of values represented by the list of fields. The resulted list is a thin view to the real underlying values. All operations above the returned list are transparently applied to this ListDataField. For example if a List.add(Object) is invoked, new data field is created and the given value is passed to the new data field.
        Specified by:
        getValue in class DataField
        Returns:
        The Value value
        See Also:
        getValueDuplicate()

      • getValueDuplicate

        public java.util.List<?> getValueDuplicate()
        Description copied from class: DataField
        Returns the duplicate of the internal value of the data field. If field's value is deemed to be NULL (isNull() return true) then the returned value is NULL. Otherwise the duplicate of the internal value is converted to appropriate object representation and returned.
        Specified by:
        getValueDuplicate in class DataField
        Returns:
        The Value value

      • toByteBuffer

        public int toByteBuffer(CloverBuffer dataBuffer,
               java.nio.charset.CharsetEncoder encoder,
               int maxLength)
                 throws java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException
        Description copied from class: DataField
        Encode the field's value into ByteBuffer. The numeric value is encoded as a string representation.
        Overrides:
        toByteBuffer in class DataFieldImpl
        Parameters:
        dataBuffer - buffer where the field's value is written
        encoder - encoder which is used for string to byte conversion
        maxLength - for string based fields (DataFieldMetadata.isByteBased() == false) maximum number of character written to output buffer; byte based fields can ignore this parameter
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object otherField)
        Description copied from class: DataField
        Checks whether two DataField objects are equal. Both fiels should be of the same type. If they are not, ClassCastException is thrown.
        Two datafields where each is flagged as to be NULL (isNull() returns true) are deemed NOT equal.
        Specified by:
        equals in class DataField
        Parameters:
        otherField - Description of Parameter
        Returns:
        Description of the Returned Value

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object otherObject)
        Description copied from class: DataField
        Compares two fields and returs -1,0,1 depending on result of comparison. Both fiels should be of the same type. If they are not, ClassCastException is thrown.
        When comparing fields where one or both are NULL (isNull() returns true), the result of comparison is that if obj is NULL the result is 1, if this.value (value of this field) is NULL, the result is -1;
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
        Specified by:
        compareTo in class DataField
        Parameters:
        otherObject - Description of the Parameter
        Returns:
        Description of the Return Value
